alert.note: Alert for Dale (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 6:56PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Dale County through 730 PM CDT... At 656 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles south of Blue Springs State Park, or 9 miles northeast of Ozark, moving west at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Ozark, Bells Crossroads, Skipperville, Dill, Roberts Crossroads, Arguta, Snells Crossroads, Barefield Crossroads, Beamon, Dale County Lake, Clopton, Phillips Crossroads, Ward Bridge, Dykes Crossroads and Bertha. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
